intro: Pleurothallis birchenallii, commonly known as the golden pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow. It is noted for its unique floral structure and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
